meanings.definition: Relating to the process of editing or revising a text.
meanings.sent1: The redactional process helped improve the clarity of the document.
meanings.sent2: The redactional changes made the article more concise.
meanings.sent3: The redactional edits turned the messy draft into a polished piece.
meanings.sent4: Her redactional skills transformed the rough draft into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The redactional work on the manuscript was meticulous and thorough.

meanings.definition: Involving the act of making changes or additions to a document.
meanings.sent1: She redactionally revised the report before submitting it.
meanings.sent2: They redactionally updated the spreadsheet with new data.
meanings.sent3: He redactionally altered the presentation to include the latest information.
meanings.sent4: The team redactionally modified the proposal to meet the client's requirements.
meanings.sent5: Redactionally adjusting the contract ensured all terms were clear and accurate.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the modification of a written work for publication.
meanings.sent1: The redactional changes enhanced the readability of the book.
meanings.sent2: Her redactional revisions improved the flow of the article.
meanings.sent3: The redactional tweaks added a professional touch to the manuscript.
meanings.sent4: The redactional adjustments elevated the quality of the final draft.
meanings.sent5: His redactional efforts ensured the document met publishing standards.
